lexUnit.name: surrender.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give up (a person, right, or possession) on compulsion or demand.

sentence.text: On May 31 , in the southern mountains of Colombia , 130 members of the Quintín Lame group surrendered their weapons to the authorities .
Britain is seen as having surrendered power to the Common Market in a way that has limited our freedom of manoeuvre and turned us into a colony of an embryonic West European federal state .
Manoon immediately surrendered himself to the authorities and was later charged with , among other crimes , conspiracy to assassinate Queen Sirikit in 1982 .
Other evidence of the Democrats in the House surrendering the initiative to the White House is to be seen in the actions of the Budget Committee .
On the demand side , small business owner-managers often do not fully appreciate the advantages of equity finance and consequently are reluctant to surrender equity to outside investors .
Gen Loehr wished to surrender all his forces to the British .
Magnus was either dragged out of sanctuary from a church on Egilsay or he voluntarily surrendered himself to his enemies .
Pablo Escobar Gaviria , 42 , the leader of the Medellín drug cartel , voluntarily surrendered himself to state authorities on June 19 .
And yet she can not surrender either of them completely .
A total of 2711 have been surrendered so far .
In the United Kingdom the legislature has effectively long since surrendered the power of the purse to the executive , but that is far from being the case in the United States .
It was Edmund Wilkie , polymath , to whom in the unlikely Edwardian luxe of the Grand Hotel in Scarborough she had most bloodily surrendered her virginity .
Before that night was out he had surrendered himself to Christ .
In return the Inuit agreed to surrender their claim to the remainder of the western area of the Northwest Territories , which would be renamed .
The patriarchal principle surrendered class solidarity to myopia and minimalism .
ARMAGH battled bravely before surrendering the initiative to Portadown during the closing ten minutes after a keenly fought first round encounter .
Nevertheless , for the scientists running the rehabilitation centres it is still a question of persuading the owners to surrender their captives rather than ordering them to do so .
We ca n't get out of here unless you surrender your ticket .
